title: The Taste of River Clay
tagline: A woman must choose between the world of surfaces and the world of depths to save the land that remembers her name.
themes: The Individual's Duty to the Collective

chapters.title: What the Land Had to Say

story: Write a poem from the perspective of the river, addressing Keeley. What does it remember that she has forgotten?
Compose a letter from Keeley's mother, Brenda Miller, justifying her choice to assimilate, using the language of 'surfaces' (practicality, security, progress).
Create a short story about a day in the life of Aunt Doreen twenty years prior, showing how she learned to 'read the land.'
Write the transcript of a Band Council meeting where the dam proposal is debated, capturing the tension between economic need and cultural survival.
technical: Build an interactive map of Parcel 0472-B, layering geological survey data with Indigenous place names, plant lore, and animal migration paths mentioned in the text.
Develop a 'Language Reclamation' text tool that visually shows the erosion of an Indigenous sentence as colonial words replace original terms, mirroring the novel's theme of 'deleting words.'

cover_prompt: A young indigenous woman, her hands caked with dark, wet river clay, presses her palms against the bark of an ancient, wise tree, feeling the land's memory pulse upwards, [Detailed Scene & Context: set at the twilight confluence of a slow-moving river and a dense, whispering forest, where ghostly, semi-transparent ancestral figures emerge from the mist and water, and geometric patterns of colonial survey maps dissolve into roots and mycelial networks], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the atmospheric, textured, and spiritually resonant style of Kent Monkman's narrative paintings and the lyrical earth-toned poetry of Anne Brigman's photographic allegories, rendered in textured impasto oil and natural pigment], [Composition & Camera: book cover framing, a centered and intimate composition with a slight low-angle looking up at the woman, creating a sense of reverence and scale, with the river leading the eye into deep, layered background], [Lighting & Color Palette: dramatic chiaroscuro lighting from a single, low sunset breaking through clouds, casting long shadows and glowing edges, with a rich, deep color palette of clay reds, riverine blues, forest greens, and twilight purples, all muted and grounded in earth tones], masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
